options.label: D

title: How teachers can help kids find their political voices - Sydney Chaffee

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's definition of social justice?

options.label: A
options.text: Social justice is a concept that refers to the idea that all people in a society deserve equal rights and opportunities.

options.label: B
options.text: Social justice is a complex concept that involves understanding and addressing systemic inequalities and biases.

options.label: C
options.text: Social justice is a simple concept that refers to the idea that all people in a society deserve fair and equitable rights, opportunities, and access to resources.

options.label: D
options.text: Social justice is a concept that refers to the idea that all people in a society deserve to be treated with respect and dignity.

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's argument for why social justice should be a part of the mission of every school and every teacher in America?

options.label: A
options.text: The author argues that social justice should be a part of the mission of every school and every teacher in America because it is a way to prepare students for the real world.

options.label: B
options.text: The author argues that social justice should be a part of the mission of every school and every teacher in America because it is a way to promote critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

options.label: C
options.text: The author argues that social justice should be a part of the mission of every school and every teacher in America because it is a way to help students understand and address systemic inequalities and biases.

options.label: D
options.text: The author argues that social justice should be a part of the mission of every school and every teacher in America because it is a way to promote civic engagement and community involvement.

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's argument for why education can be a tool for social justice?

options.label: A
options.text: The author argues that education can be a tool for social justice because it provides students with the knowledge and skills they need to succeed in the world.

options.label: B
options.text: The author argues that education can be a tool for social justice because it provides students with the opportunity to learn about and address systemic inequalities and biases.

options.label: C
options.text: The author argues that education can be a tool for social justice because it helps students develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

options.label: D
options.text: The author argues that education can be a tool for social justice because it helps students understand and address their own biases and assumptions.

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's argument for why teachers should support students who choose to walk out of school to protest social justice issues?

options.label: A
options.text: The author argues that teachers should support students who choose to walk out of school to protest social justice issues because it is a way to promote civic engagement and community involvement.

options.label: B
options.text: The author argues that teachers should support students who choose to walk out of school to protest social justice issues because it is a way to help students develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

options.label: C
options.text: The author argues that teachers should support students who choose to walk out of school to protest social justice issues because it is a way to help students understand and address systemic inequalities and biases.

options.label: D
options.text: The author argues that teachers should support students who choose to walk out of school to protest social justice issues because it is a way to promote student autonomy and self-expression.

multiple-choice.question: What is the author's argument for why teaching and learning should be more authentic and engaging for students?

options.label: A
options.text: The author argues that teaching and learning should be more authentic and engaging for students because it is a way to promote student autonomy and self-expression.

options.label: B
options.text: The author argues that teaching and learning should be more authentic and engaging for students because it is a way to help students develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

options.label: C
options.text: The author argues that teaching and learning should be more authentic and engaging for students because it is a way to help students understand and address systemic inequalities and biases.

options.label: D
options.text: The author argues that teaching and learning should be more authentic and engaging for students because it is a way to promote civic engagement and community involvement.

title: The most extreme births in the animal kingdom

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the way kiwi birds give birth to their chicks?

options.label: B
options.text: The females lay a single egg that is up to 20% of their body weight.

options.label: C
options.text: The chicks are born hairless and quill-less.

options.label: D
options.text: The males give birth to the chicks.

options.label: B
options.text: The mother lays an egg sac and then the spiderlings hatch and eat her.

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the way Tasmanian devils give birth to their joeys?

options.label: A
options.text: They give birth to up to 50 joeys at a time, each the size of a grape.

options.label: B
options.text: They give birth to up to 50 joeys at a time, each the size of a raisin.

options.label: C
options.text: They give birth to up to 50 joeys at a time, each the size of a human.

options.label: D
options.text: They give birth to only one joey at a time.

multiple-choice.question: What is a challenge faced by the joeys of the Tasmanian devil?

options.text: They have to find their own food.

options.label: B
options.text: They have to crawl from the mother's birth canal, over her body, and into her pouch.

options.label: C
options.text: They have to compete with each other for the mother's milk.

options.label: D
options.text: They have to fend for themselves from birth.

title: How feng shui shaped Hong Kong's skyline

multiple-choice.question: What is the main idea behind Feng Shui, the ancient Chinese practice?

options.label: A
options.text: To create a balanced and harmonious environment that promotes good luck and fortune.

options.label: B
options.text: To design buildings with sharp angles to cut the good Qi and create bad luck.

options.label: C
options.text: To arrange furniture and interior design in a way that attracts bad luck.

options.label: D
options.text: To ignore the advice of Feng Shui masters and create bad luck.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the dragon gates in Hong Kong's buildings?

options.label: A
options.text: To keep the dragons from entering the water and causing bad luck.

options.label: B
options.text: To let the dragons fly through and bring good luck.

options.label: C
options.text: To ward off bad luck and protect the buildings from negative energy.

options.label: D
options.text: To attract tourists and create a unique architectural feature.

multiple-choice.question: Why did the developers of the Communist Bank of Red China ignore the Feng Shui masters' advice?

options.label: A
options.text: They wanted to create a modern and sleek design that would attract more customers.

options.label: B
options.text: They believed that Feng Shui was an old-fashioned superstition and had no basis in reality.

options.label: C
options.text: They wanted to save money on Feng Shui consultants and ignored their advice.

multiple-choice.question: What did the Feng Shui masters suggest to Disneyland Hong Kong to improve the luck of the park?

options.label: A
options.text: They suggested shifting the entrance by 12 degrees to create a blockade from the good luck escaping the park.

options.label: B
options.text: They suggested building a new attraction to attract more visitors.

options.label: C
options.text: They suggested ignoring the Feng Shui principles and creating a modern design.

options.label: D
options.text: They suggested using Feng Shui to attract more customers and increase sales.

multiple-choice.question: What did the government of Hong Kong pay out between 2011 and 2016 to people who complained about Feng Shui disturbance?

options.label: B
options.text: $1.1 million dollars

options.label: C
options.text: $10 million dollars

options.label: D
options.text: $100 million dollars
